metadata.title: CVE-2022-48686 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Compliant (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:nvme-tcp: fix UAF when detecting digest errors We should also bail from theio_work loop when we set rd_enabled to true, so we don't attempt to readdata from the socket when the TCP stream is already out-of-sync orcorrupted.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-48686` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1092-fips - 5.4.0-1092.102
linux-image-unsigned-hmac-5.4.0-1092-fips - 5.4.0-1092.102
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-1033-ibm - 5.15.0-1033.36~20.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-5.4.0-1020-xilinx-zynqmp - 5.4.0-1020.24
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1118-aws-fips - 5.4.0-1118.128+fips1
linux-image-unsigned-hmac-5.4.0-1118-aws-fips - 5.4.0-1118.128+fips1
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1123-azure-fips - 5.4.0-1123.130+fips1
linux-image-unsigned-hmac-5.4.0-1123-azure-fips - 5.4.0-1123.130+fips1
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1122-gcp-fips - 5.4.0-1122.131+fips1
linux-image-unsigned-hmac-5.4.0-1122-gcp-fips - 5.4.0-1122.131+fips1
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro
